DataElement.preferredName: Isolated Chemotherapeutic Limb Perfusion Limb Infusion Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term for the anatomic site of isolated limb infusion (ILI) or isolated limb perfusion (ILP).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Isolated Chemotherapeutic Limb Perfusion Limb Infusion Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A procedure used to deliver anticancer drugs directly to an arm or leg but not to the rest of the body. The flow of blood to and from the limb is temporarily stopped with a tourniquet (a tight band around the limb). Catheters (small, flexible tubes) attached to a pump are put into an artery and a vein in the limb so that blood can be circulated through the pump into the limb. Anticancer drugs are injected into the catheters. Wrapping the limb in a heated blanket or warming the drugs or blood may help the drugs work better._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream._Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: A procedure used to deliver anticancer drugs directly to an arm or leg but not to the rest of the body. The flow of blood to and from the limb is temporarily stopped with a tourniquet (a tight band around the limb). Catheters (small, flexible tubes) attached to a pump are put into an artery and a vein in the limb so that blood can be circulated through the pump into the limb. Anticancer drugs are injected into the catheters. Wrapping the limb in a heated blanket or warming the drugs or blood may help the drugs work better.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the left side of the body.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the left side of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the right side of the body.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the right side of the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.
